agency: Department of Game and Inland Fisheries

species.name: Redbreast Sunfish

images.name: Redbreast Sunfish
images.credit: Duane Raver, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

species.identification: Sunfish family. Basically olive to brownish gray along the back, merging to blue with a golden cast along its sides and a bright orange to yellow underside.\nHas several irregular bluish stripes on its cheek and gill cover. Identifiable by a long, black opercular (gill) flap. Reaches about 8 inches.

1.description: See Virginia Freshwater Fishing & Watercraft Ownerâ€™s Guide for generic statewide fishing restrictions.

best_fishing.description: Rivers: South Fork Shenandoah, Nottoway, Rapidan, Rappahannock, Maury and Cowpasture.

fishing_techniques: Small spinner baits, spinner bucktails, grubs and tiny crankbaits. Spring and fall are the best times, but they are active throughout the summer.
